meanings.definition: A projecting beam or structure supported at one end only.
meanings.sent1: The cantilevers of the bridge extended gracefully over the river.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the building with cantilevers to create a modern look.
meanings.sent3: The cantilevers of the shelf seemed to defy gravity, holding up the heavy books.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence cantilevers outwards, supporting her through any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The cantilevers of the diving board made it seem like it was floating in the air.

meanings.definition: To project in the manner of a cantilever.
meanings.sent1: The crane cantilevers the heavy load over the construction site.
meanings.sent2: He carefully cantilevers the shelf onto the wall brackets.
meanings.sent3: The tree branch cantilevers outwards, providing shade for the picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her words cantilevered into the room, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The artist cantilevers the sculpture to create a sense of movement and balance.

meanings.definition: A bracket or block projecting from a wall to support a balcony, cornice, etc.
meanings.sent1: The cantilevers on the old building were intricately carved and decorative.
meanings.sent2: The balcony was held up by ornate cantilevers that added charm to the house.
meanings.sent3: The cantilevers on the ancient castle looked like they were reaching out to touch the sky.
meanings.sent4: The cornice cantilevers gave the building a unique architectural flair.
meanings.sent5: The cantilevers on the historic church were a testament to the craftsmanship of the builders.
